sections.title: Critical Legal Deadlines Overview
sections.script:
As an administrator, you're responsible for ensuring the platform meets all legal deadlines. Missing these deadlines can result in significant penalties and legal liability.

**The Four Critical Deadlines:**

1. **NCMEC Reporting: 24 Hours**
   - Triggered by: CSAM detection
   - Clock starts: Detection confirmation
   - Consequence: Federal crime, $300K/violation

2. **DSA Response: 14 Days**
   - Triggered by: EU user complaint
   - Clock starts: Complaint submission
   - Consequence: Up to 6% global revenue

3. **GDPR Response: 30 Days**
   - Triggered by: Data subject request
   - Clock starts: Request verification
   - Consequence: Up to €20M or 4% revenue

4. **2257 Record Availability: 48 Hours**
   - Triggered by: FBI inspection request
   - Clock starts: Notice received
   - Consequence: 5-10 years imprisonment

**Why Deadline Management Matters:**
- Legal compliance is non-negotiable
- Penalties are severe
- Reputation damage can be worse than fines
- Creates audit trail for regulators
- Demonstrates good faith compliance

sections.title: NCMEC 24-Hour Reporting
sections.script:
NCMEC reporting has the shortest deadline and highest stakes.

**Requirement:**
18 U.S.C. § 2258A requires reports within 24 hours of detection.

**Workflow:**

**Hour 0: Detection**
- PhotoDNA/PDQ hash match
- Content automatically blocked
- Alert to Compliance team

**Hours 0-2: Verification**
- Confirm hash match
- Verify not false positive
- Gather required information

**Hours 2-8: Report Preparation**
- Compile upload information
- Gather account details
- Prepare evidence package

**Hours 8-16: Report Filing**
- File CyberTipline report
- Include all required fields
- Attach evidence

**Hours 16-24: Confirmation**
- Confirm submission receipt
- Document report number
- Note any follow-up required

**Automation:**
- Detection triggers automatic alert
- Report template pre-populated
- Countdown clock visible
- Escalation if approaching deadline

**Monitoring:**
- Dashboard shows open CSAM cases
- Time remaining for each
- Assigned handler
- Status tracking

**What Can Go Wrong:**
- Weekend/holiday detection (staff needed 24/7)
- System issues (manual backup process)
- Missing information (gather immediately)
- Volume spikes (additional resources)

sections.title: DSA 14-Day Response
sections.script:
DSA complaints from EU users require response within 14 calendar days.

**Requirement:**
Digital Services Act Article 20 requires internal complaint handling with response within 14 days.

**Workflow:**

**Day 0: Receipt**
- Complaint logged in system
- Automatic acknowledgment sent
- 14-day clock starts
- Assigned to handler

**Days 1-3: Initial Review**
- Review complaint content
- Identify relevant content/decision
- Gather context

**Days 4-7: Assessment**
- Review original decision
- Assess complaint arguments
- Consult policy if needed

**Days 8-10: Decision**
- Make decision (uphold/overturn)
- Draft Statement of Reasons
- Quality check

**Days 11-13: Response**
- Send response to complainant
- Notify affected parties
- Document completion

**Day 14: Deadline**
- Must be completed by end of day
- No extension available

**Tracking:**
- Dashboard shows all open DSA complaints
- Days remaining color-coded
- Red flag at 3 days remaining
- Escalation at 1 day remaining

**Volume Management:**
- Monitor complaint volume trends
- Staff appropriately
- Have backup handlers identified
- Cross-train team members

sections.title: GDPR 30-Day Response
sections.script:
GDPR requests have 30 days for response, with limited extension options.

**Requirement:**
GDPR Article 12(3) requires response within one month (30 days).

**Extension Possible:**
- Can extend by 2 months for complex requests
- MUST notify user within initial 30 days
- Explain why extension needed
- Common for: large data sets, verification issues

**Workflow:**

**Day 0: Receipt**
- Request logged
- Request type identified
- Identity verification initiated

**Days 1-5: Verification**
- Verify requester identity
- Clock starts when verified
- If can't verify, clock paused

**Days 6-15: Data Gathering**
- Collect data from all sources
- Apply exceptions (2257, legal holds)
- Prepare response

**Days 16-25: Quality Review**
- Review data package
- Ensure completeness
- Redact third-party data

**Days 26-30: Response**
- Send response to user
- Document completion
- Note any retention exceptions

**Extension Process:**
- Identify need for extension early
- Notify user by day 25
- Document reason
- Set new deadline (max 60 more days)
- Track new deadline

**Tracking:**
- Dashboard shows all open GDPR requests
- Days remaining
- Extension status
- Assigned handler

sections.title: 2257 FBI Inspection
sections.script:
2257 requires records available for FBI inspection, typically with 48-hour notice.

**Requirement:**
18 U.S.C. § 2257 requires records available during business hours, with 48-hour notice typical (can be less).

**What FBI Inspects:**
- Age verification records
- Performer identification
- ID document copies
- Stage name cross-references
- Content URL records
- Custodian of Records statement

**Preparation (Ongoing):**
- Records organized and indexed
- Searchable database
- Can retrieve any record in 20 minutes
- Backup copies secured
- Custodian identified and trained

**When Notice Received:**

**Immediately:**
- Acknowledge receipt
- Notify Legal and Custodian
- Begin preparation

**Within 24 Hours:**
- Verify all records accessible
- Test retrieval system
- Prepare workspace for inspectors
- Brief Custodian of Records

**Inspection Day:**
- Custodian present and available
- Records accessible
- Legal may be present
- Cooperate fully
- Document what is inspected

**After Inspection:**
- Document any findings
- Address any deficiencies
- Update procedures if needed

**Continuous Readiness:**
- Monthly record audits
- Quarterly system tests
- Annual full review
- Updated training

paths.escalation: Immediate to Compliance Officer, then CEO

interactiveElements.title: GDPR Extension Template
interactiveElements.template:
Dear [User],

We have received your data subject request dated [Date]. Due to the complexity of your request [explain reason], we require additional time to process it fully.

Under GDPR Article 12(3), we are extending our response period by [X] months. You can expect our complete response by [New Date].

If you have questions, please contact [Contact].

Sincerely,
[Data Protection Officer]

questions.question: What is the NCMEC reporting deadline?
questions.explanation: CSAM must be reported to NCMEC within 24 hours of detection per 18 U.S.C. § 2258A.

questions.question: Can the DSA 14-day deadline be extended?
questions.explanation: Unlike GDPR, the DSA 14-day deadline has no extension mechanism. It's a strict requirement.

questions.question: How long can GDPR response be extended?
questions.explanation: GDPR allows extension by up to 2 months for complex requests, with notification required within initial 30 days.

questions.question: How quickly must 2257 records be retrievable?
questions.explanation: 2257 records must be retrievable within 20 minutes during an FBI inspection.

questions.question: When should DSA deadline alerts escalate?
questions.explanation: DSA deadline alerts should escalate at 7 days, 3 days, and 1 day remaining to ensure timely response.
